posts.html:
@Phelplan Yeah paying some life in the mix is fitting for a "boss" black creature. Especially a vampire would want a taste of blood for his services.

Regarding what's in his hand: Take a look at the art on Castle Sengir (drawn by the same artist). It's probably not the moon, as it appears the moon is the source of that glow in the upper right corner of this card. If you compare the art of both, it places him on the battlements of the castle's back corner. Anyone can be forgiven for not being overly familiar with the art of such a sub-par land.

Anyway, I'd say it's probably an Icy or else just your standard crystal ball used for gazing into while you stand around outside the castle. Ya know, like ya do. Or if you're a fan of The Dark Tower series you can say it's one of the bends 'o the rainbow heh-heh.

posts.post_content:
Powercreeped, but I still have my old Baron in my vampire deck because oldschool. Sometimes I power him out with Dark Rituals like nature intended, or I discard him and then cheat him out of the graveyard.  
  
Like [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas), the Baron should be reborn as a planeswalker. If we revisit the Innistrad world in a future block, perhaps...  
  
Baron Sengir, Planeswalker ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)  
Loyalty 3  
  
+2: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature  
-2: Search your library for a vampire card with converted mana cost five or less and put it onto the battlefield.  
-9: You get an emblem "all vampires you control have indestructible and 'when another creature dies the same turn this creature damages it, put two +1/+1 counters on this creature."
